THE APPLICANT PROVIDES INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT SERIVICES TO A PRIVATE POOLED INVESTMENT VEHICLE -THE KROHNE FUND - THAT IS OFFERED TO INVESTORS ON A PRIVATE PLACEMENT BASIS. KROHNE FUND INVESTS FOREMOST IN GLOBAL EQUITIES AS LONG TERM INVESTOR. KROHNE CAPITAL HAS ONE CLIENT: KROHNE FUND. KROHNE CAPITAL MAKES ALL THE INVESTMENT DECISIONS FOR KROHNE FUND. THE FORM D FILE NUMBER IS 021-176015  THE APPLICANT HAS BEEN RETAINED AS A SUB-ADVISOR BY EM VALUE AG, SWITZERLAND. EM VALUE ITSELF HAS BEEN RETAINED AS A SUB ADVISOR BY THE MANAGER OF A MUTUAL FUND (AVH EMERGING MARKETS FONDS) ICM INVESTMENTBANK, GERMANY.  IN THIS CAPACITY KROHNE CAPITAL MAKES SUGGESTIONS TO BUY OR SELL SECURITIES, BUT HAS NO SAY WHETHER THOSE SUGGESTIONS WILL BE ACTED UPON. KROHNE DOES NOT HAVE DISCRETION OVER TRADES, CANNOT SELECT OR COMMUNICATE WITH BROKERS. AS OF JANUARY 2021, THE ASSETS OF THIS BALANCED FUND WERE 26 MILLION EUROS.

AFC institutional Fund Manager LLC acts solely as adviser to AFC Institutional Fund LLC (“AFCIF”) which was formed upon the conversion of AFC BDC Inc. (“AFC BDC”) from a Maryland corporation to a Delaware limited liability company. AFC BDC was a closed-end investment company that elected to be treated as a business development company (“BDC”) under the Investment Company Act of 1940, as amended and was advised by a prior registered investment adviser. AFC BDC subsequently withdrew its BDC status and converted to AFCIF, a private fund. AFCIF is not open to new investors and its primary purpose is to hold debt investments to maturity for its remaining investor prior to effecting dissolution.

ITEM 7A: REGISTRANT HAS ADDITIONAL RELATED ENTITIES THAT ENGAGE IN FINANCIAL INDUSTRY-RELATED ACTIVITIES. REGISTRANT DOES NOT: (1) HAVE BUSINESS DEALINGS WITH THESE RELATED ENTITIES IN CONNECTION WITH ADVISORY SERVICES PROVIDED TO REGISTRANT'S CLIENTS; (2) CONDUCT SHARED OPERATIONS WITH THESE RELATED ENTITIES; (3) REFER CLIENTS OR BUSINESS TO THE RELATED ENTITIES, AND THE RELATED ENTITIES DO NOT REFER PROSPECTIVE CLIENTS OR BUSINESS TO REGISTRANT; (4) SHARE SUPERVISED PERSONS OR PREMISES WITH RELATED PERSON; AND (5) HAVE REASON TO BELIEVE THAT ITS RELATIONSHIPS WITH THESE RELATED ENTITIES OTHERWISE CREATE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST WITH ITS CLIENTS. REGISTRANT MAINTAINS A SUPPLEMENTARY LIST OF SUCH RELATED ENTITIES THAT ARE NOT LISTED IN SCHEDULE D, SECTION 7.A. FOR THE REASONS PROVIDED ABOVE. THIS LIST IS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.

ITEM 7.A: CREDIT SUISSE INSURANCE LINKED STRATEGIES LTD (“CSILS”) WAS RENAMED EULER ILS PARTNERS LTD (“EULER”) (TOGETHER THE “COMPANY”). THE COMPANY WAS PREVIOUSLY UNDER THE CONTROL OF UBS GROUP AG (FORMERLY CREDIT SUISSE GROUP AG) (“UBS”), A FOREIGN BANK HOLDING COMPANY BASED IN SWITZERLAND, WHICH HAS HUNDREDS OF LEGAL ENTITIES, U.S. AND FOREIGN SUBSIDIARIES AND AFFILIATES WORLDWIDE WHO ARE ENGAGED IN A VARIETY OF SECURITIES, BROKER DEALER, INVESTMENT COMPANY, INVESTMENT ADVISER, BANKING, COMMODITIES, CONSULTING, REAL ESTATE AND CUSTODY ACTIVITIES.   ON JULY 23, 2024, UBS AND EULER ILS PARTNERS HOLDING AG ENTERED INTO A DEFINITIVE AGREEMENT WHICH PROVIDES FOR A MANAGEMENT BUY-OUT (THE “TRANSACTION”, THE “SALE”, THE “BUY-OUT”) THROUGH THE ACQUISITION OF ALL THE SHARES OF CSILS BY EULER ILS PARTNERS HOLDING AG. SINCE SEPTEMBER 30, 2024, UPON CLOSING OF THE TRANSACTION, THE COMPANY IS OPERATING INDEPENDENTLY FROM UBS. THE DISCLOSURES HEREIN PERTAIN TO EULER ILS PARTNERS LTD AND NOT FORMER AFFILIATES THAT WERE ASSOCIATED WITH UBS. REGULATORY ACTION DISCLOSURE REPORTING IN CONNECTION WITH UBS AND RELATED RELEVANT AFFILIATED COMPANIES, PLEASE REFER TO FORMER ADV FORM FILINGS.   "IRIS OPPORTUNITY I SP", FORMERLY NAMED "IRIS (US) POST-EVENT OPPORTUNITIES I SP" IS A SEGREGATED PORTFOLIO OF "IRIS SPC", FORMERLY NAMED "IRIS (US) SPC", A CAYMAN ISLANDS SEGREGATED PORTFOLIO COMPANY. IN ACCORDANCE WITH INSTRUCTION 6.C. OF THE INSTRUCTIONS TO FORM ADV, PART 1A, EULER TREATS "IRIS OPPORTUNITY I SP" AS A DISTINCT PRIVATE FUND. THE PRIVATE FUNDS LISTED IN SECTION 7.B OF SCHEDULE D (EITHER ALONE OR ALONGSIDE OTHER NON-U.S. FUNDS THAT ARE NOT DISCLOSED IN SECTION 7.B) MAY TRANSACT WITH/THROUGH AND/OR HOLD SHARES OF A SPECIAL PURPOSE INSURERS (“SPI”) AND/OR REGULATED INSURERS OR SPECIAL PURPOSE VEHICLES (“SPV”). TYPICALLY, THESE ARE FORMED FOR THE PRIMARY PURPOSE TO ACCESS (RE-)INSURANCE RISKS AND DERIVATIVES THEREOF. THE COMPANY MAY DELEGATE SENIOR EMPLOYEES TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF SUCH RISK TRANSFORMERS (E.G. CLASS 3A INSURER, SPECIAL PURPOSE INSURER). FOR EXAMPLE, BERNINA RE IS A BERMUDA-DOMICILED CLASS 3A LICENSED REINSURER LICENSED AND REGULATED BY THE BERMUDA MONETARY AUTHORITY. BERNINA RE IS WHOLLY OWNED BY BERNINA RE HOLDING LTD. BERNINA RE HOLDING LTD HAS BEEN CAPITALIZED BY CERTAIN INVESTMENT FUNDS MANAGED BY THE COMPANY. ANY PROFITS EARNED BY BERNINA RE FOR FRONTING AND OTHER SERVICES ON BEHALF OF THE PORTFOLIO AND OTHER FUNDS MANAGED BY THE COMPANY MAY BE FOR THE ULTIMATE BENEFIT OF SUCH FUNDS. BERNINA RE OPERATES INDEPENDENTLY FROM THE COMPANY AND ITS EMPLOYEES, EXCEPT THAT NIKLAUS HILTI IS A MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF BERNINA RE LTD AND BERNINA RE HOLDING LTD. BERNINA RE PERFORMED THE SOURCING, UNDERWRITING, RISK PRICING AND MODELLING OF TRADITIONAL REINSURANCE TRANSACTIONS FOR THE PORTFOLIO AND OTHER FUNDS MANAGED BY THE COMPANY (WITH RESPECT TO TRANSACTIONS TRANSFORMED BY BERNINA RE). IN DOING SO, BERNINA RE COOPERATES VERY CLOSELY WITH THE COMPANY. TRANSACTIONS WITH RISK TRANSFORMERS MAY GIVE RISE TO CERTAIN CONFLICTS OF INTEREST. ADDITIONAL INFORMATION ABOUT THESE RISK TRANSFORMERS AND RELATED CONFLICTS OF INTEREST CAN BE FURNISHED UPON REQUEST.  IN CONNECTION WITH THE COMPANY’S BOOKS AND RECORDS, PURSUANT TO THE SALE OF THE COMPANY BY UBS, CERTAIN BOOKS AND RECORDS RELATED TO THE COMPANY’S HISTORICAL OPERATIONS CONTINUE TO BE MAINTAINED BY UBS AND ITS AFFILIATES. THESE RECORDS PRIMARILY INCLUDE PRE-SALE COMPLIANCE RECORDS, FINANCIAL RECORDS, FUND AND INVESTMENT RECORDS AS WELL AS OTHER DOCUMENTS CREATED DURING THE PERIOD WHEN THE COMPANY OPERATED AS A SUBSIDIARY OF UBS GROUP AG RESPECTIVELY CREDIT SUISSE GROUP AG.

ITEM 5. E/F/G APPLICANT PROVIDES INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT SERVICES TO A NUMBER OF CLIENTS WHICH ARE ORGANIZED AS PRIVATE INVESTMENT PARTNERSHIPS (THE "PARTNERSHIPS") EXEMPT FROM REGISTRATION UNDER THE INVESTMENT COMPANY ACT OF 1940 PURSUANT TO EITHER SECTION 3(C)(1) OR SECTION 3(C)(7).  THE APPLICANT RECEIVES MANAGEMENT FEES FROM THE PARTNERSHIPS GENERALLY RANGING FROM 1.0% TO 2.5% PER ANNUM BASED ON EACH PARTNERSHIPS'S COMMITTED CAPITAL OR ASSETS UNDER MANAGEMENT.  MANAGEMENT FEES ARE PAYABLE IN ADVANCE ON A QUARTERLY BASIS.  IN ADDITION, THE APPLICANT IS AFFILIATED WITH EACH OF THE ENTITIES ACTING AS GENERAL PARTNERS OF THE PARTNERSHIPS.  THE GENERAL PARTNER ENTITIES RECEIVE AS A PERFORMANCE FEE ALLOCATION A PORTION OF THE NET GAINS OF SUCH PARTNERSHIPS RANGING FROM 10% TO 25% OF SUCH GAINS.  SUCH PERFORMANCE FEE ALLOCATIONS ARE GENERALLY DISTRIBUTED TO THE GENERAL PARTNER OF A PARTNERSHIP AT THE SAME TIME SUCH DISTRIBUTIONS ARE MADE TO THE LIMITED PARTNERS OF THE PARTNERSHIPS.  THE SPECIFIC TERMS OF SUCH PERFORMANCE ALLOCATIONS COMPLY WITH RULE 205-3 OF THE INVESTMENT ADVISERS ACT AND EACH OF THE LIMITED PARTNERS OF THE PARTNERSHIPS IS A "QUALIFIED CLIENT."

PER SEC DEFINITION, AN ADVISER IS DEEMED TO HAVE CUSTODY OF CLIENT ASSETS WHEN IT HOLDS, "DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY, CLIENT FUNDS OR SECURITIES OR HAS ANY AUTHORITY TO OBTAIN POSSESSION OF THEM.  AUTUMN WIND ASSET MANAGEMENT, AS A REGISTERED INVESTMENT ADVISOR, DOES NOT DIRECTLY HOLD CUSTODY OF CLIENT ASSETS.  ALL ASSETS ARE HELD BY CHARLES SCHWAB & COMPANY.  HOWEVER, AUTUMN WIND ASSET MANAGEMENT ALSO SERVES AS THE GENERAL PARTNER TO THE AUTUMN WIND GLOBAL MULTI-STRATEGIES FUND (THE "FUND").  A FIRM THAT ACTS AS BOTH GENERAL PARTNER AND INVESTMENT ADVISER TO A LIMITED PARTNERSHIP IS DEEMED TO HAVE CUSTODY OF ASSETS EVEN IF THOSE ASSETS ARE HELD BY AN INDEPENDENT CUSTODIAN.   BY VIRTUE OF ITS POSITION AS GENERAL PARTNER, THE ADVISER GENERALLY HAS AUTHORITY TO DISPOSE OF FUNDS AND SECURITIES IN THE LIMITED PARTNERSHIP'S ACCOUNT AND THUS IS CONSIDERED TO HAVE CUSTODY OF CLIENT ASSETS.  HENCE, AUTUMN WIND IS STATING THAT IT HAS CUSTODY OF ASSETS, YET ALL ASSETS ARE HELD WITH AN INDEPENDENT CUSTODIAN (CHARLES SCHWAB).  IN ADDITION, THE FUND'S NET ASSET VALUE CALCULATION IS PERFORMED BY AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNT FIRM (FLEMING FINANCIAL).  FLEMING MAILS MONTHLY STATEMENTS DIRECTLY TO LIMITED PARTNERS.  THE FUND IS ALSO AUDITED ANNUALLY (O'SULLIVAN CREEL) AND COPIES OF THE AUDIT ARE PROVIDED TO LIMITED PARTNERS.

ITEM 7A: REGISTRANT HAS ADDITIONAL RELATED ENTITIES THAT ENGAGE IN FINANCIAL INDUSTRY-RELATED ACTIVITIES. REGISTRANT DOES NOT: (1) HAVE BUSINESS DEALINGS WITH THESE RELATED ENTITIES IN CONNECTION WITH ADVISORY SERVICES PROVIDED TO REGISTRANT'S CLIENTS; (2) CONDUCT SHARED OPERATIONS WITH THESE RELATED ENTITIES; (3) REFER CLIENTS OR BUSINESS TO THE RELATED ENTITIES, AND THE RELATED ENTITIES DO NOT REFER PROSPECTIVE CLIENTS OR BUSINESS TO REGISTRANT; (4) SHARE SUPERVISED PERSONS OR PREMISES WITH RELATED PERSON; AND (5) HAVE REASON TO BELIEVE THAT ITS RELATIONSHIPS WITH THESE RELATED ENTITIES OTHERWISE CREATE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST WITH ITS CLIENTS. REGISTRANT MAINTAINS A SUPPLEMENTARY LIST OF SUCH RELATED ENTITIES THAT ARE NOT LISTED IN SCHEDULE D, SECTION 7.A. FOR THE REASONS PROVIDED ABOVE. THIS LIST IS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.

The Registrant qualifies as an exempt reporting adviser (an “ERA”) and, as such, is not subject to the recordkeeping requirements of Rule 204-2 under the Investment Advisers Act of 1940 (the “Advisers Act”). As a result, the Registrant marked “no” in response to the question in Item 1.L. Regarding Schedule D, Section 7.A. for Agventures II GP, LLC and Agventures III GP, LLC (each, a “GP Entity”), the Registrant notes that each GP Entity is the general partner to the Registrant’s private fund client. Each GP Entity is not filing its own Form ADV but is instead relying on the interpretive guidance outlined in the “Frequently Asked Questions on Form ADV and IARD” on the SEC’s website under the heading “Reporting to the SEC as an Exempt Reporting Adviser.” That guidance essentially permits a GP entity to a private fund to rely on the Form ADV of the fund’s investment adviser. In addition, as an ERA, the Registrant is not subject to Rule 205-3 under the Advisers Act, and it is not currently subject to a state law equivalent, which would require fund investors to be qualified clients. As a result, Registrant has marked “no” in response to question 15(b) of Schedule D, Section 7.B.(1). Finally, regarding Schedule D, Section 7.B.(1) for each of its private fund clients, Question 25(a), the Registrant notes that its private fund client maintain their cash reserves with Grasshopper Bank.

SECTION 7.B(1) OF SCHEDULE D, questions 19 and 20: REGISTRANT SERVES AS THE INVESTMENT ADVISER TO PRIVATE FUNDS FORMED TO INVEST AND TRADE IN SECURITIES. REGISTRANT SOLICITS INVESTORS WHO MAY OR MAY NOT BE CLIENTS OF REGISTRANT TO INVEST IN SUCH FUNDS.

"Prime Set BitDrift SPV LLC" is a single-LP investment vehicle established for a family office’s investment in BitDrift, Inc. I have no decision-making authority and provide no advisory services to the SPV. However, I personally hold a 15% economic interest in the SPV's profits (after recovery of the initial investment), as assigned by the SPV. The SPV operates independently of other funds managed by Prime Set Management LLC.  For BitDrift Series A Oct 2023, a Series of CGF2021 LLC, created on the Sydecar platform for an investment in BitDrift, Inc., Prime Set Management LLC facilitated the SPV's creation but has no decision-making authority, provides no advisory services, and receives no carried interest. All operational and compliance responsibilities are managed by Sydecar LLC, and this SPV operates independently of Prime Set Management LLC and its funds.  For DE Fund I, a Series of Prime Additions, LP, managed by AngelList Advisors LLC, Prime Set LLC receives carried interest for its role as a Sub-Adviser but does not have primary investment decision-making authority. This SPV operates independently of other advisory activities conducted by Prime Set Management LLC, and all material decisions are made by AngelList Advisors LLC.  These SPVs and related investment vehicles are disclosed for transparency, and none are considered advisory clients of Prime Set Management LLC. All material decisions for these SPVs are made by their respective managing entities, including AngelList Advisors LLC, Sydecar LLC, or the SPV’s controlling members."
